attributes.comment:
As a three time adoptive parents currently on our fourth adoption, my husband
and I
strongly oppose an increase in fees for immigration petitions, particularly for
adoption
applications.
Over the years we have seen a steady increase in application fees. This is
unfair to
people trying to immigrate to the U.S..Many are in dire financial straights.
We are adopting a little girl from China with Cerebral Palsy. In addition
to her
adoption fees and immigration fees we are looking at a lifetime of increased
medical expenses. It's our
desire to give an orphaned child a better life in our wonderful country. We
sacrifice to do this. To learn our own government
is making things more difficult is insulting to us and our good intentions.
This will
create hard ship for many adoptive families who are citizens of this country. I
wonder
what is the justification.
These days with the adoptions dragging out to over 18 months some adoptive
parents
will have to pay twice because their 1717H's have expired. Please reconsider
raising
fees for immigration petitions. For many adoptive parents as well as people
hoping to
immigrate to this fine country, this increase will be a hardship.

Donna Schwartz
Newark DE
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Donna Schwartz
